abstracts.cdata!:
The project's major objectives were
            achieved and the outcome judged as satisfactory overall. In
            terms of sustainability the outcome is rated as uncertain.
            The key lesson learned is the importance of the government
            having a clear strategy on maintenance funding, in
            particular for feeder roads, and demonstrating the
            effectiveness of funding by adequate and timely release of
            required funds. A corollary to this is that a clear
            implementation strategy is equally important, especially in
            light of the current decentralization process. Other lessons
            learned are: involve stakeholders in decisionmaking earlier
            and more directly; simplify economic evaluation and
            selection methods; address high design standards and
            resulting problem of over-investment, particularly because
            traffic volumes remain very low even after rehabilitation;
            pursue labor-based construction; rehabilitate feeder roads
            using a network approach; and set up a road fund with a
            clear mechanism for raising revenue and an autonomous board
            to enhance the stability of maintenance funding.
